sense.name: an abstract connection
sense.commentary: The ways in which things are similar or connected
sense.examples: The linguistic relation between constituents is amazing. The judge inquired as to the temporal relation between the two complaints. He specified the spatial relations of every piece of furniture on the stage.

sense.name: storytelling
sense.commentary: RELATION[+event] An act of narration, telling or recounting
sense.examples: He was a hero according to his own relation. The relation of a story by Suzy involves a lot of gestures.

sense.name: state of affairs
sense.commentary: The way that people or groups behave toward one another, mutual dealings or connections among persons or groups
sense.examples: Canada has established full diplomatic relations with the U.S. I'm looking for someone who can handle all of our customer relations. International relations had not improved since the last meeting. Relations broke down between them.

sense.name: relatives/family
sense.commentary: A person related by blood or marriage
sense.examples: He has distant relations back in New Jersey. His Christmas cards read "Just sayin' salutations to my friends and relations".

sense.name: sex
sense.commentary: The act of sexual procreation between a man and a woman
sense.examples: I do believe that John and Mary have had relations. Extramarital relations are an indicator that it's time for couples counseling. "I did not have sexual relations with that woman." -Clinton

sense.name: principle
sense.commentary: The principle that an act done at a later time is deemed by law to have occurred at an earlier time.
sense.examples: His attorney argued for the relation back of the amended complaint to the time the initial complaint was filed.
